授業目的:
1. To develop students’ TOEIC listening skills
2. To develop students’ TOEIC reading skills 
3. To help students build their vocabulary knowledge 
4. To help students improve their overall test-taking strategies
5. To help students become aware of common distractors 
6. To help students better understand English as it is used in everyday work and life situations
到達目標:
1. Students will develop their listening and reading skills.
2. Students will strengthen their vocabulary knowledge. 
3. Students will become better test-takers, carefully attentive to common distractors. 
4. Students will familiarize themselves with natural English.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
1. This course will be conducted in English only and English will be the means of communication between the students and the instructor.  (Students will also be expected to communicate with one another in English.)
2.  Students are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions, both independently and collaboratively, in order to enhance their competence and confidence in English and also to create a better learning environment for all.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
1. Active participation is extremely important and counts as a significant part of students’ evaluation marks. 2. Attendance is crucial to students’ success in this course. The instructor will carefully mark students’ attendance as present and on time, late, or absent. Specific rules regarding attendance are as follows: 2a) Only students who are present at the time the class begins will receive full attendance marks. 2b) Any student walking into the classroom after the class has begun will be marked late. The instructor will take this into account when giving students a participation grade. 2c) Being 15 to 29 minutes late will equal half an absence (0.5). 2d) Each time students are late 30 minutes or more, they will be marked absent. However, they are still encouraged to attend. 2e) As a general rule, no more than three absences will be permitted in this course.
評価.備考Note0: In principle, the use of smartphones, tablets, and other electronic devices in the classroom is forbidden. Students must store them in their bags throughout the entire duration of each class. In the case of a project in which internet connection is necessary, the instructor may instruct students to use their electronic devices, but unless such a situation is specifically and clearly suggested by the instructor, their use will be strictly prohibited.
